thread.title: Jimi Hendrix's estate want a $1m guitar stolen by an ex-Earth, Wind, and Fire member back - Music
thread.title_full: Jimi Hendrix's estate want a $1m guitar stolen by an ex-Earth, Wind, and Fire member back - Music News - Digital Spy

author: Amy Davidson
title: Jimi Hendrix's estate want a $1m guitar stolen by an ex-Earth, Wind, and Fire member back - Music
text: In the latest bizarre musical legal battle, the estate of Jimi Hendrix is fighting to reclaim a guitar they claim was stolen by a former member of Earth, Wind, and Fire.According to court documents Experience Hendrix LLC, the company in charge of Hendrix's estate, are claiming Harvey Moltz of Rainbow Guitars doesn't have the rights to own the legendary musician's guitar. © David Redfern/Redferns Moltz says he bought the guitar from someone who purchased it from Sheldon Reynolds, the ex-husband of Hendrix's adopted sister Janie Hendrix and former member of Earth, Wind, And Fire.The Black Widow acoustic guitar, owned by Hendrix at the time of his death in 1970, has been valued at $750,000 to $1 million, the Arizona Daily Star reports."The guitar is priceless to our family," Janie, who is CEO of Experience Hendrix, said. © PA Images "It is one of the few guitars that came home after Jimi passed away. We just want our guitar returned safely and back where it belongs."Moltz's lawyer claims his client bought the guitar lawfully and that he has "no interest in acquiring or retaining stolen property".
